isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (with R-134a Refrigerant System) - AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM SERVICE - DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM (REFRIGERANT RECOVERY)

warning.para: Before doing any of the work below, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the Service Warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

important.para: Although your service equipment may appear physically different from the equipment shown here, the function of the equipment used to perform each service procedure is basically the same. If you are performing these service procedures using service equipment different from that shown, refer to the manufacturer's instructions supplied with that equipment.
If the system is being discharged because a leak is suspected, the leak must be located before discharging the system. Refer to LEAK DETECTION.

note.para: The locations of the A/C system high pressure and low pressure service ports vary by vehicle model and year. The high pressure service port is located on the compressor's high pressure discharge line between the compressor and the expansion valve. Typical locations are on the receiver-dryer or on the compressor. The low pressure port is located on the compressor suction line, between the expansion valve and the compressor.

Discharge and suction ports are usually marked on the compressor head. If the marking is not visible, you can identify the suction (low pressure) side by the larger diameter hose connected to the compressor.

step1.para: Empty the 'recovered oil' catch bottle on the recovery station. This will make it easier to determine the amount of oil recovered during the refrigerant recovery procedure.
Remove the protection caps from both service ports.

On the recovery station and hose fittings, verify that all valves are closed. The valves at the recovery station must be set to the CLOSED position. The valves at the quick connect fittings must be set fully counter-clockwise (CCW).
Connect the recovery station to the system as follows:

step2.para: Connect the blue hose to the low pressure service port.
Connect the red hose to the high pressure service port.

step1.para: Open (turn clockwise) the valves on the Metric SAE quick connect fittings connected to the service ports on the vehicle.
Set both hand valves on the recovery station to the RECOVERY/VACUUM position.

Turn the recovery station main power switch on and press the RECOVER button. The recovery station will automatically shut off when the refrigerant in the system has been exhausted to the storage tank.
Close the quick connect valves, and set both valves on the recovery station to the CLOSED position.

When recovering refrigerant by use of a recovery station, system oil is separated from the refrigerant during the recovery cycle. When the refrigerant recovery operation is complete, the recovery station will drain the oil into the station's calibrated catch bottle. The amount of oil recovered may be used to determine the amount of NEW oil that must be added back to the A/C system. Refer to OIL FILL GUIDELINES.
Remove the blue and red hoses from the service ports on the refrigerant compressor.
Work may now begin on the air conditioning system.
